page.title: 18Tourist Attractions 2.
page.content: { The Library The Library is situated in the High Street.The Building used to be the British School built in 1846.The school sign can still be seen in the Car Park at the rear of the Library. Above the front door is the Yorkshire Rose and the date 1969.This happens to be the date that the building became a Library. {The Old Pump The Old Pump on the High Green was built in 1880.It was made originally out of stone until it was destroyed and rebuilt with wood.The Pump is therefore only a replica.The trough is still there for people to look at.The present pump was made by{J.R.BAINES.} Any visitors to Great Ayton should take the time to look at the village pump.You never know{CAPTAIN COOK}may have used it when he was a boy! {
